full_job_description:
Panel Wirer
 Contract role 
Machine Building Industry
Leicester, LE8
Days Shifts - Early Finish Friday
Pay rate £22 CIS or £17 Paye 
Are you an experienced Panel Wirer looking for an exciting Contract opportunity within a developing industry? If yes, read on.... 
I'm excited to share an opportunity with a forward-thinking engineering company that's on the lookout for an experienced Panel Wireman or Control Wirer. This is an ideal role for someone who thrives in high-precision environments and has a proven track record in Panel Wiring.
The Role - Panel Wirer:
- Building and wiring control panels
- Machine wiring
- Working to wiring schematics
- Using a variety of hand tools
- Day Shifts, Early Finish Friday
 Minimum Skills / Experience Required - Panel Wireman:
- Extensive experience in panel wiring or machine control wiring
- Strong understanding and experience with schematics
- Ability to use the required hand tools
- The ability to work with minimal supervision and deliver high standards
- Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
- Motivated and excellent team player
- Able to commute to the LE8 area
 The Package - Electrical Fitter:
- Basic salary of £17 per hour paye or £22 CIS
- Overtime available daily
- Free onsite parking

full_job_description: Are you an experienced Supervisor, Team Leader or Workshop Manager from the Engineering Manufacturing industry? Would you like to lead and develop a motivated team within an established family-owned business? Our client is a leading engineering manufacturer based in Leicester. They are currently looking for new Production Supervisor to run their fabrication workshop. Commutable from Coventry, Hinckley, Rugby, Nuneaton and other areas close to South Leicestershire. The Role - Fabrication supervisor - To lead, motivate and manage a team of fabricators on a daily basis. - Liaising with the office regarding bespoke requirements and sharing thoughts and experience regarding more complex specifications. - To oversee all works being carried out in the workshop to ensure customer satisfaction at all times. - Interpreting drawings received. - Welding various fabricated material. - Oversee laser cutting, shearing, folding, punching, and rubbering material using the relevant machinery. - Arranging adequate and relevant training for new and existing staff as necessary. - Working with other staff members effectively by coordinating workload. - Adhering to health and safety regulations. - All other duties as required that are considered to be a reasonable employer request. - At least 5 years' experience in metal sheet fabrication. - Competent with all aspect of fabrication. - Use of CAD drawings - Forklift licence would be preferable but not essential - Accurate measuring ability and good numeracy skills and experience of using measuring equipment. - The ability to understand the drawings provided. - Relevant qualifications would be desirable. - Previous welding/sheet metal experience essential. - Amada machinery experience preferable. The Package - Fabrication/shop floor supervisor  - Starting salary up to £36k per annum - Pension - Day Shifts - Mon to Thurs 07.30-16.30, Friday 07.30-1400

full_job_description: Job Role: Estimator Location: Leicester Salary: £38,000-£45,000 Monday-Thursday 7.45 am-4.45 pm Friday 7.45 am- 2.15 pm Are you an experienced Estimator with a strong background in structural, secondary, or architectural steelwork? We're looking for a driven and detail-focused professional to join our Housebuilding division and play a key role in securing and delivering successful projects. About the Role In this exciting and varied position, you will manage the full tendering process from receiving enquiries and interpreting technical drawings to producing competitive bids and converting them into manufacturing packages. You'll work closely with internal teams and customers to ensure quotations are clear, accurate, commercially sound, and fully aligned with project requirements. You will also take ownership of customer relationships, identifying new opportunities and supporting ongoing business growth. Responsibilities: Read and interpret technical tender drawings and specifications, Extract and price materials accurately, Build detailed costings for materials, labour, plant, and site operations, Establish and manage supply chain costs, Produce and issue professional quotation documents, Liaise with clients to secure new and repeat business, Negotiate and finalise tenders, Maintain a consistent understanding of market pricing, Provide prompt, high-quality responses to all enquiries, Lead handover meetings with Contract Managers following tender. Skills & Experience: Minimum 3 years' experience in a similar estimating role, Strong understanding of structural, secondary, and architectural steelwork, Ability to read technical and architectural drawings, Good knowledge of building regulations, contract law, and health & safety legislation, High attention to detail with strong numerical and commercial awareness, Excellent IT, communication, and negotiation skills, Strong time management and organisational abilities, CRM experience and a full UK driving licence are About PrecisionPeople. full_job_description:
CNC Operator  
Location: Leicester LE4  
Hours: Monday to Thursday - 20.00 - 06.15  
Payrate -    
Interviews Happening Immediately  
Are you a skilled in Operating a CNC Milling and Turning Machine and looking for your next opportunity? We're working with a well-established and growing engineering firm in Leicester who are looking to add to their friendly team.  
This role offers great rates of pay,steady Night shifts,  and the opportunity to go permanent for the right person.  
What You'll Be Doing  
- Running a cell, operating a CNC Machine
- Working from detailed engineering drawings
- Operating CNC Milling and Turning Machines
- Machining components to a high standard
- Reporting to the machine shop Manager
- Occasionally working independently on varied jobs and materials

- An experience CNC Milling and Turning operative
- Strong background in operating CNC Machines
- Confident reading technical drawings
- 3+ years experience working within an engineering environment
- Someone who can hit the ground running with operating a CNC Milling and turning machine
- Someone who is willing to learn and progress

full_job_description:
Production Scheduler
Location: Leicester
Salary: up to £40,000 DOE40-hour working week: Mon–Thu 07:30–16:45, Fri 07:30–12:30
A long-established, fast-growing manufacturing business is seeking a highly motivated Production Scheduler to join its expanding operations team.
You will be responsible for building and maintaining an accurate production schedule, ensuring work is released to the shop floor in line with customer requirements and agreed delivery dates.
Key Responsibilities
- Develop and maintain a detailed production schedule across all manufacturing departments, ensuring output aligns with customer commitments as a Production Scheduler
- Release jobs to production with complete and accurate information, supporting smooth workflow and minimising disruption.
- Analyse demand and capacity to optimise work centre loading, avoid bottlenecks, and maximise utilisation of machinery and labour.
- Monitor production progress in real time, proactively adjusting schedules in response to operational changes, labour availability, or equipment issues.
- Maintain full visibility and traceability of work in progress using scheduling tools and reporting systems as a Production Scheduler
- Collaborate closely with Sales, Estimating, Operations, and Procurement to ensure production plans support overall business priorities.
- Support proactive customer communication by reviewing delivery changes during office-stage processing and ensuring timely escalation where needed.
- Identify and resolve scheduling issues such as material shortages, lead-time variances, and resource conflicts.
- Track and report on key KPIs, including:
- Drive continuous improvement in planning accuracy and production efficiency through data-driven analysis.
- Work alongside Production Management and IT support to enhance ERP and planning systems.
- Take ownership of scheduling KPIs such as schedule adherence and DIFOT (Delivery in Full, On Time), analysing variances, and driving corrective actions as a Production Scheduler
Minimum Skills / Experience Required:
- Proven experience in production scheduling or planning within a manufacturing environment.
- Strong understanding of ERP systems and planning principles, with confidence in interpreting system-generated data.
- Excellent organisational and time-management abilities.
- High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and commitment to quality.
- Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work using your own initiative.
- Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a professional and courteous manner.
- Integrity, honesty, and a positive attitude toward innovation and change.
- Ambition to build a long-term career within a growing business.
Benefits
- Competitive salary
- Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual)
- Life assurance
- Above-statutory holiday entitlement, with additional service-linked days
- 40-hour working week: Mon–Thu 07:30–16:45, Fri 07:30–12:30 (flexibility required)
- On-site gym
- Pension scheme
- Investment in ongoing training and development
- Provided workwear and PPE
- On-site parking and staff canteen
- Employee Assistance
About PrecisionPeople
PrecisionPeople is a leading recruitment agency that specializes in sourcing top talent for Engineering, Technical, Sales, and Senior Management roles across a wide range of industries. With a focus on precision and quality, their team of expert recruiters works tirelessly to match the best candidates with the right employers, ensuring that both parties benefit from a successful partnership.
PrecisionPeople has the expertise and resources to help you find the perfect role. With a deep understanding of the industry and a commitment to excellence, they have built a reputation for delivering exceptional results and exceeding their candidates' expectations.
Interested?
To apply for the Production Planner position, here are your two options:
1. "This is the job for me! When can I start?" - Call now and let’s talk through your experience. Ask for Kirsty Reeves on (phone number removed) between 8.00am - 5.00pm.
2. "I think I'm right for this position, but I'm not sure I have enough to get an interview" - Click "apply now" so I can read your CV and let you know.

- High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and commitment to quality.
- Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work using your own initiative.
- Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a professional and courteous manner.
- Integrity, honesty, and a positive attitude toward innovation and change.
- Ambition to build a long-term career within a growing business.

full_job_description: About the Company: A well-established engineering and manufacturing business, recognised for producing high-quality sheet metal and fabricated components for a range of industries. With ongoing investment in modern machinery and a commitment to developing their people, they're now seeking an experienced Press Brake Setter Operator to join their team. The Press Brake Setter Operator Role: As a Press Brake Setter Operator, you'll be responsible for setting, operating, and adjusting CNC press brake machines to produce precision sheet metal parts in line with customer specifications. Key Responsibilities: Set and operate CNC press brake machines (Amada, Bystronic, Trumpf, or similar). Read and interpret technical drawings and engineering plans. Carry out first-off inspections and ensure quality throughout production. Adjust machine settings and tooling to achieve accurate folds and dimensions. Maintain equipment, report faults, and ensure safe working practices. Work efficiently to meet production targets and deadlines. About You: Proven experience setting and operating CNC press brakes. Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings. Positive, proactive attitude with good communication skills.

full_job_description: Want to see your welds make a real impact? If you’ve got MIG welding experience and want to join a company that actually invests in your skills, this is the one. You’ll be working on high quality sheet metal projects for major customers, using modern equipment in a clean, organised workshop where precision and pride really matter. This is a busy, long established manufacturer in Loughborough with around 100 staff and a full order book stretching well into next year. They’re known locally for looking after their people, promoting from within and offering genuine training opportunities to help you progress in your career. Job Title: MIG Welder Location: Loughborough, Leicestershire Hours: Rotating shifts Monday to Friday, 06:00-14:00 / 14:00-22:00 Contract Type: Permanent Pay: £14.00 - £15.50 per hour (based on experience, reviewed after probation) Benefits: Profit Share Scheme, Multi Skilled Bonus (£1/hr extra), Overtime Pay Premiums, 30 Days Holiday (Including Bank Holidays), Enhanced Sick Pay and Healthcare Plan, Group Life Cover, Clear Career Progression Path, Training and Upskilling Opportunities, Internal Promotion Opportunities and Cycle to Work Scheme. Your Responsibilities: - Carry out MIG welding on sheet metal components, ensuring strong and accurate welds - Set up and adjust welding equipment for various materials and specifications - Read and interpret engineering drawings to achieve precise, consistent results - Perform quality checks using measuring tools to verify weld integrity - Support grinding and finishing of welded components as required What We’re Looking For: - Proven experience in MIG welding within a manufacturing or fabrication environment - Ability to interpret drawings and produce accurate, high quality welds - Competence with grinders, finishing tools and fabrication equipment - A good eye for detail and pride in producing clean, professional work - Reliable, adaptable and confident working both independently and as part of a team Recruitment Process: To apply, simply upload your CV below or contact Josh Whitmore on (phone number removed) or (url removed) Successful candidates will then be invited to an onsite interview and MIG welding skills test with the Team Leader. Ready to take your welding career further with a company that values your craft?

salary_benefits: £55,000 - £60,000/annum. Competitive salary and benefits package.
full_job_description:
A growing engineering business specialising in the design and manufacture of bespoke automation and mechanical systems is seeking an experienced Engineering Project Manager to join its expanding team. The company operates across regulated and industrial sectors, delivering complex, high-precision systems that meet demanding technical and regulatory standards.
As a well-established and employee-focused organisation, the business continues to invest in innovation and people, with a strong pipeline of new projects and long-term customer partnerships.
**The Role**  
 As Engineering Project Manager, you’ll take ownership of multiple projects from initial concept through to final delivery. You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
This is a hands-on, delivery-focused position that requires both technical understanding and strong commercial acumen. You’ll work closely with customers, engineering teams, and senior stakeholders to drive accountability and successful outcomes across the full project lifecycle.
**Key Responsibilities**
- Lead and manage several concurrent engineering projects (typically 3–4 at a time) from concept through to completion.
- Ensure all projects meet contractual and commercial milestones, including agreed payment stages.
- Take ownership of project budgets, costings, and margins.
- Plan and allocate resources effectively across design, build, and commissioning teams.
- Lead structured design reviews and ensure adherence to engineering standards and compliance requirements.
- Act as the main customer contact throughout the project, managing scope changes, risks, and technical queries.
- Ensure projects meet internal quality, documentation, and handover standards.
- Drive continuous improvement across processes, design delivery, and communication.
**About You**  
 We’re looking for an experienced and proactive Project Manager with a strong background in automation, machinery, or special-purpose equipment design. You’ll be commercially aware, technically capable, and confident managing cross-functional teams and customers in a dynamic environment.
**Key Skills & Experience**
- Degree-qualified in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
- Minimum 10 years’ experience managing engineering or automation projects.
- Strong technical understanding of automated systems, robotics, or machinery.
- Proven experience in regulated or high-precision industries (medical, healthcare, packaging, etc.).
- Confident managing budgets, timelines, and multi-disciplinary engineering teams.
- Skilled communicator with the ability to manage stakeholders at all levels.
- Proficient in Microsoft Project or similar project management tools.
**Personal Attributes**
- Hands-on and delivery-focused with a strong sense of ownership.
- Collaborative, calm under pressure, and customer-oriented.
- Able to balance technical, commercial, and operational priorities effectively.
- Willingness to travel occasionally within the UK and overseas.
**What’s on Offer**
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Opportunity to lead innovative engineering projects with real impact.
- A supportive environment with autonomy, variety, and career growth potential.
- Work within a forward-thinking, employee-driven business investing in technology and people.
If this role would be of interest to you, please click apply today.
description_snippet: A growing engineering business specialising in the design and manufacture of bespoke automation and mechanical systems is seeking an experienced Engineering Project Manager to join its expanding team. The company operates across regulated and industrial sectors, delivering complex, high-precision systems that meet demanding technical and regulatory standards. As Engineering Project Manager, you’ll take ownership of multiple projects from initial concept through to final delivery. You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

Drive continuous improvement across processes, design delivery, and communication. Key Skills & Experience: Degree-qualified in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline. salary_benefits: £45,000 - £50,000/annum. Benefits: Permanent position, Free onsite parking, Company events, Company pension, Overtime available.
full_job_description:
Job Title: Toolroom Manager
Location: Leicestershire
Shift: Monday - Thursday, 8am - 5pm and Friday, 8am - 4pm
Pay: Up to £50,000 per annum
Benefits:
- Permanent position
- Free onsite parking
- Company events
- Company pension
- Overtime available
The Company
A well-established manufacturer of high-precision plastic injection moulds, supplying a range of key industries across the UK and Europe.
The Toolroom Manager Role:
We are currently seeking a driven and committed Toolroom Manager to join our growing team. This position has become available due to continued business growth, with projected expansion of over 50% in the next year. We're looking for motivated individuals to help us meet this demand.
We take pride in maintaining a clean, organised, and professional toolroom. The successful candidate will play a key role in sustaining and improving standards of organisation, cleanliness, and overall presentation.
- Liaise with the customer to understand their needs within a project and communicate this clearly to the design and manufacturing team.
- Tool design, Mould flow and DFM interrogation to check feasibility and suitability of the design against the customers and moulders needs.
- Understand and interrogate part and tool designs for manufacturability and efficiency
- Assign daily workload to the shopfloor staff and explain each job to them as required
- Troubleshoot manufacturing issues from CNC machining, EDM machining and fitting issues.
- Monitor progress and provide regular updates to customers
- Create project plans showing the timeline of key activities in the project
- Attend the final tool build checklist with the fitting team, making sure the quality standards are met before we despatch tooling to customers
- Buying of mould bases, standard mould parts, cutting tools and other workshop equipment.
- Project management of Chinese tooling, communicating with our project managers oversees to check progress and quality. International travel could be available but not essential.
- Attend tool trials and provide support to the process team for troubleshooting
- Review parts from trials and understand injection moulding process/tooling defects
- Create tooling rework plans and oversee trial loop until approved
About You:
- Strong technical background in plastics and tooling
- Experience in interpreting 2D and 3D engineering drawings
- Background in tool design, mould flow analysis, and DFM reviews
- Involvement in managing varied tooling projects from start to finish
- Hands-on experience with CNC machining, EDM, and tool fitting processes
- Proven people management and organisational skills
- Excellent attention to detail and quality standards
- Flexibility to adapt to different projects and changing priorities
- Strong communication skills to liaise with customers and internal teams
- Ability to create and manage project timelines and tooling plans
How to Apply: To apply for the Toolroom Manager position, click Apply Now and upload your CV. A member of our recruitment team will contact you to discuss your application and next steps.
description_snippet: A well-established manufacturer of high-precision plastic injection moulds is seeking a driven and committed Toolroom Manager to join their growing team in Leicestershire due to continued business growth and projected expansion. The role involves managing the toolroom, maintaining high standards, and overseeing varied tooling projects from design to approval.
responsibilities_snippet: Key responsibilities include: Liaising with customers; Tool design, Mould flow and DFM interrogation; Understanding and interrogating part and tool designs; Assigning daily workload; Troubleshooting manufacturing issues (CNC, EDM, fitting); Monitoring progress and providing updates; Creating project plans; Attending final tool build checklist; Buying mould bases, standard parts, and equipment; Project management of Chinese tooling; Attending tool trials and providing support; Reviewing parts from trials and understand injection moulding process/tooling defects; Creating tooling rework plans. Requirements/Skills ('About You'): Strong technical background in plastics and tooling; Experience interpreting 2D and 3D engineering drawings; Background in tool design, mould flow analysis, and DFM reviews; Involvement in managing varied tooling projects; Hands-on experience with CNC machining, EDM, and tool fitting processes; Proven people management and organisational skills; Excellent attention to detail and quality standards; Flexibility; Strong communication skills; Ability to create and manage project timelines and tooling plans.

full_job_description:
Job Opportunity: CAD/CAM Engineer (Sheet Metal Manufacturing)
Location: Leicester, East Midlands
Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE)
Hours: Monday - Thursday, 07:30 - 16:00 (40 hours per week), Friday 12:30 Finish
Type: Permanent, Full-Time
Start Date: Immediate
About the Company
Our client is a leading UK metal manufacturing specialist, they partner with major national brands across industries such as rail, transport, retail, and construction.
A family-run business, they pride themselves on their commitment to quality, investment in cutting-edge technology, and dedication to developing their people. With over 100 skilled employees, the company continues to grow year-on-year thanks to its focus on innovation, craftsmanship, and exceptional customer service.
The Role: CAD/CAM Engineer
As a CAD/CAM Engineer, you will play a crucial role in producing high-quality and dimensionally accurate engineering drawings and CNC programs for the manufacturing of sheet metal components. You will work closely with production and clients to ensure orders meet technical specifications, efficiency standards, and quality expectations.
Key Responsibilities
- Create accurate 2D CAD/CAM profiles in line with client specifications.
- Develop CNC programs that maximise efficiency in material use and machine time.
- Produce detailed manufacturing drawings for press, fabrication, and assembly operations.
- Update and modify CAD/CNC data as required.
- Maintain organised drawing and program records.
- Communicate clearly with clients regarding order details and requirements.
- Prepare Bill of Materials (BOM) lists for the purchasing team to ensure all project materials are available.
Skills & Experience
Essential:
- Proficiency in 2D CAD software (AutoCAD or TruTops preferred).
- Strong SolidWorks experience (sheet metal design essential).
- Solid understanding of sheet metal manufacturing processes.
- Confident user of MS Office / Office 365, particularly Excel and Teams.
Desirable:
- Experience with Trumpf CAM software (advantageous but not essential).
Personal Attributes
- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in work.
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Professional, approachable, and adaptable attitude.
- Focused and reliable under pressure.
- Innovative problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
- Enthusiastic about developing a long-term career in manufacturing.
Benefits
- Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE).
- Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual).
- Life assurance.
- Enhanced holiday entitlement with service-linked increases.
- Pension scheme.
- Company-provided workwear and PPE.
- On-site gym, canteen, and parking.
- Employee Assistance Programme.
- Continuous training and career development opportunities.
About Regional Recruitment Services
This role is advertised by Regional Recruitment Services Ltd, an award-winning independent recruitment agency established in 2008. We specialise in connecting skilled professionals to opportunities across the Engineering, Industrial, and Technical sectors.
Contact Us: (phone number removed)
Visit: (url removed)
If you are passionate about precision engineering and want to progress your career with a respected and growing manufacturer, apply today or call our Industrial team for more details.

The role is Permanent, Full-Time, with hours Monday - Thursday, 07:30 - 16:00 (40 hours per week), and Friday 12:30 Finish.
